Song.title: Power to Redeem
Song.copyright: Lauren Daigle, Paul Mabury & Justin Ebach Â© 2014 Wordspring Music, LLC

Arrangement.text:
[D]
Verse 1: You [D]take what is, And you make it [G]beautiful. [Bm] [A] When [D]love floods in, We're restored for[G]evermore. [Bm] [A]
Chorus: With breat[G]h that brings the dea[D]d to life, With word[A]s that pierce the dar[Bm]k with light, [G]Only by the bloo[D]d are we set free[A]. With me[G]rcy strong to ca[D]rry shame and na[A]il it to a tre[Bm]e, You alo[G]ne hold the [A]power to rede[D]em!
Verse 2: No [D]guilt competes With innocence [G]crucified. [Bm] [A] No [D]grave can hold what your grace has [G]justified. [Bm] [A]
{new_page} Bridge: Re[D/F#]joice oh child of Go[G]d! [D]Lift your eyes to see[A]: With [D/F#]every morning ligh[G]t, A[D]gain we are re[A]deemed!
Final Chorus: Oh, with breat[G]h that brings the dea[D]d to life, With word[A]s that pierce the dar[Bm]k with light, [G]Only by the bloo[D]d are we set free[A]. With me[G]rcy strong to ca[D]rry shame and na[A/C#]il it to a tre[Bm]e, You alo[G]ne hold the [A]power to rede[D]em! [Bm] Oh you alo[G]ne hold the [A]power to rede[Bm]em! Oh you alo[G]ne hold the [A]power to rede[D]em!
Arrangement.searchtext: verse 1 you take what is and you make it beautiful when love floods in were restored forevermore chorus with breath that brings the dead to life with words that pierce the dark with light only by the blood are we set free with mercy strong to carry shame and nail it to a tree you alone hold the power to redeem verse 2 no guilt competes with innocence crucified no grave can hold what your grace has justified bridge rejoice oh child of god lift your eyes to see with every morning light again we are redeemed final chorus oh with breath that brings the dead to life with words that pierce the dark with light only by the blood are we set free with mercy strong to carry shame and nail it to a tree you alone hold the power to redeem oh you alone hold the power to redeem oh you alone hold the power to redeem
